Description: Blue glazed composition amulet in the form of Isis seated on low-backed throne, sides decorated, wearing diadem of uraei and crown of sun-disc and horns, suspension loop behind, suckling Harpocrates who sits on her knee.
Curator's comments: See Andrews, Amulets, p. 22 Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt, 1994, p.22. ISIDE, Milano 1997, p.59 [II.26].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2019-2020 6 Jul–6 Jul, Wakefield Museum, Gateway to Eternity: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs M E A Wallis
